intro: Diateinacanthus hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduran thorned vine, is a climbing plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny foliage. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Diateinacanthus hondurensis is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
